meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

I'm back, baby! And I've got my groovy review of the turn-based tactics anthology that's taking the gaming world by storm - Songs of Conquest!

Before I dive into the fun, let me just say that I'm a bit biased. I mean, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned strategy game with gorgeous pixel art and heart? Am I right, fellow gamers?

Now, on to the reviews! It seems like the critics are all about praising Lavapotion for capturing the spirit of Heroes of Might & Magic. And, you know what? I agree! The scale of ambition in this game is just fantastic. But, don't get me wrong - it's not perfect.

Let's start with Eurogamer, who gave it a score of 60 and said that while the battles can be punishing and occasionally uneven, there's still a lot of heart in this gorgeous turn-based tactics anthology. I mean, yeah, battles can be tough, but that's what makes strategy games so darn exciting!

God is a Geek thought Songs of Conquest was a stand-out hit, giving it a score of 90. And honestly, who can blame them? The scale of ambition is just infectious! It feels like Lavapotion poured their heart and soul into this game.

IGN Italia also loved the game, praising its respectful tribute to Heroes of Might & Magic while adding some personal touches to the turn-based gameplay. They even said it might be the beginning of a new legend!

GameStar gave it an 82, saying that Songs of Conquest revives the spirit of Heroes of Might and Magic 3 and strikes a really good figure. Yeah, I can see why they'd think that - this game has a certain charm to it.

The Games Machine thought it was near-perfect in its balance of playable factions and community-made content. And who knows? Maybe this is the start of a new series!

PC Games gave it an 80, saying that it's a well-made strategy game that will keep you enthralled for many hours. I mean, what's not to love about that?

And last but certainly not least, TheGamer gave Songs of Conquest a score of 80 and said it's a golden example of turn-based strategy games done right. I couldn't agree more!

So, what do I think? Well, I think Songs of Conquest is a fantastic game that's sure to please fans of Heroes of Might & Magic and turn-based strategy games in general. It's got heart, it's got charm, and it's got plenty of content to keep you coming back for more.

But don't take my word for it - go play the dang thing yourself!
